intro: Hieracium periphanes, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Hieracium periphanes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, thriving in sunny conditions.
